title: Aight fed up with the smurfs time for the name and shame.
body:
_name removed_ and _name removed._

I will be posting this every hour on the hour to avoid the names being removed until someone fucking does something about them.

Literally just came into a game, ran it down mid into my tower giving me like 6 kills, then after they realised i was snowballing hard off their team started to actually try and easily stomped us into the ground, then went back to not trying to draw the game out.

They are a cancer on the game.

The list of names will only continue to grow as i encounter more until riot makes a concerted effort to ban these %%%%s, this way people will know to dodge as these games are literally a coin flip, either they will carry you, or throw the game on purpose to maintain b5.

replies.body:
I get you're angry, but this is not the right way to deal with it. Posting names here doesn't get anyone banned and it makes it a big hassle for me to deal with :(

I admire your tenacity but you're not directing it to where it's most effective. If you want to get these 2 people banned you've got to make your case to [**Riot** support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). I know you don't like to do that, but right now it's the most effective way to punish trolls like the ones encountered. 

Thanks :D

Tele is right. Take a screenshot and make a support ticket.
It does work. Also it's the only way to get champ select keyboard commando's reprimanded for bad behavior.

It doesnt work* ftfy

Riot has no rule against smurfing because they deem it a healthy aspect of the game.

Im now on my twelth loss in this losing streak.

I didnt know tilt could last so long that literally almost 12 hours after you last played you are still tilted.

Smurfs arent healthy, they are literally a cancer on the health of the game.

Until riot pulls their head out of their asses and realizes that smurfing is the video game equivalent of pairing a 300 pound mma fighter against a 5 year old, nothing will be done about them.

This isnt csgo where a high elo smurf can still lose easily in low elo if the enemy team has good aim.

This is league where there is so many minute little details and variables to account for aside from "aim, hearing, and knowing where to smoke" that makes it almost impossible to win against smurfs.

I say almost impossible because the smurf could DC.

Tilt can last that long, heck I've had tilt last for weeks. It all depends on your mind and how you are reacting.
In the end, it comes down to _acceptance_. I've actively controlled my mind to calm down and accept what the current state/changes were and just move on. The ranked system is far from perfect, but you can still work with it.

> Riot has no rule against smurfing because they deem it a healthy aspect of the game.

As for Riot, they do not endorse smurfing, and it is a difficult problem to control:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/lets-talk-smurfs-snow-and-bans-ask-riot

If they try to put in powerful restrictions, it would affect people who don't smurf at all. We're talking about trying to segregate millions of accounts here, I'd say it's rather damn hard to find something that would work in general but wouldn't disadvantage some others.

Tbh imho an individual skill based elo system would solve smurfing rather neatly.

The only way to maintain a low elo would be to play the majority of your games to a horrid level of skill.

Like im talking you never ward, dont take objectives, do no damage and intent feed, and if smurfs did that to maintain their low elo they would just get banned anyway for reasons other than smurfing (namely griefing)

Itd also put more emphasis on the individual rather than the team.

Its no lie that riot wants league to be a team game, but its also no lie that the community attributes rank to individual skill.

Take myself yes im b5, but personally i believe that gives me more ground to stand on when it comes to talking about this stuff, because where as people who have escaped bronze are clearly more than capable of solo carrying their way out of it, i myself am not.

Does that mean i deserve bronze? well unless league is a 1v9 game, no actually.

If riot wants league to be a team game then they have to understand that a teams performance is made up of the sum of its parts and it is only as strong as the average between the weakest and strongest link.

As such if you are to be expected to carry yourself out of an elo, and i mean carry not just consistently play good, you need to not only be the mmr of your goal elo, you have to be HIGHER than that, because your skill level needs to be high enough that the average between your team and yourself equals your target elo.

If im supposed to be in silver 5.

And my team is bronze 5.

Then the average skill level between us would be somewhere around bronze 3.

Which is funny because i carry myself to bronze 3 on the regular then take a slump as it starts to get harder and harder to 1v9.

This shows up even more if i join a 5 man premade with friends, since we actually know each other and have a team dynamic its usually just a pub stomp, because individually we are all good, but together we are far better.

This shows in a friend of mine from awhile back elmo, he was challenger in his ranked 5's team because he wasnt being paired with "retards" his solo queue was plat because despite being challenger he lacked the individual skill to carry a plat game, id say he probably belonged somewhere in mid diamond.

I still had a lengthy response to your other comment that I hadn't finished yet, but I'll post a short one here.

I didn't get out of Bronze by 1v9ing. While going through Bronze I learnt there are two sort of competing methods of thought.
One is "the 1v9, I must super carry 30/0/0 every game" or similar method of thinking. This kind of thinking is VERY tempting, and unless you are super good mechanically and perform significantly better than everyone _consistently_, will not work for most people in winning games. In fact, I personally found it detrimental to my own play as I would make more mistakes, play too aggressive, and die waaaaaaay too much. You may have this problem a bit, at an average of 10.5 deaths your last 20 ranked games.

The other method of thought, can be harder to get to. It's kind of like "I will do my best to do my job for the team, so that the enemy's base is destroyed". This means you "carry" but not in the traditional sense, you still carry by doing your role's "job" as best you can to give your team the best chance of taking down the enemy's base.
It's hard to explain, but you can do this a lot more consistently than aiming to go 10+/0 every game because most games that won't happen.

I was in the same situation too. When in B4 B5 I thought, I should at least be around S5 skill level? Sure I might have been in some areas, but overall I still had so much to learn. I "learnt" the rank system, in that winning games =/= super carrying every game.

Are you kidding me? The guy gave you 6 kills and you couldn't close the game with them? I'm sorry but there's a reason you're stuck in bronze and it's not because of smurfs. Learn how to capitalize when you're ahead and don't give the enemy a chance to catch up. This is a dumb post.
Wouldn't it make you the focus? Maybe the enemy team worked as a team and his/her team didn't.
Yes, it would, but if you're fed enough and play smart enough you can easily turn a fight around since you're so insanely ahead of everyone.

This would be where the appropriate skill/ mechanics level would come in. Even if your fed a bit and at the same skill level roughlt, how can you take on 1 v 3 etc... Especially if your mates are pain training in...?

give me a lead and a 1v3 ill win the 1v3.

Give me a lead a 1v3 and a feeding team negating my lead by giving them equivalent gold?

I might win the 1v3 maybe, but id be yelling at my teammates every painful moment of it.

This is why if my team is good enough to not feed i will carry them 9/10, they dont even have to be good, just dont die 40 times and know to push lanes thats all i need to be able to carry a team period, everything else i need so an advantage etc i can acquire myself.

Are you retarded? I did capitalize, i took those 6 kills and turned them into 32 kills.

It didnt help that my team was quite literally useless (not figuratively i mean they literally just let me do all the work and walked around farming jungle and dying) and i had to 3v1 the somewhat fed vayne jinx and kha.

The reason we lost is because i was the only useful person on the team and the second the two gold smurfs stopped trolling and they went for a 5 man push i couldnt solo defend the base.

When the fuck did you mention in the original post that you turned 6 kills into 32 kills? That just makes it even worse... you lost a game with 32 kills handed to you. You deserved that loss because you couldn't close the game. End of.

its almost like they are getting worse.

Ill also go be a math teacher and instead of telling people that 1+1 does not equal 3, ill let little timmy (bronze player) think 1+1=3 until he figures it out by himself, until of course i get angry calls from their parents (winrate) and get my pay cut for not teaching good (mmr)

or to put it in league terms.

I wont tell my top laner to drop a ward since he keeps getting ganked.

And after the 20th time telling him i wont scream at him for being an illiterate piece of shit that cant understand a concept as simple as "if i can see them they cant gank me"

Im talking im abusing for failing basic, fucking fundamentals of the game, that they shouldve learned back in bots, let alone the numerous norms that they had to play to reach level 30.

it fucking baffles me, infact thats where most of the tilt comes from, im frustrated that people that stupid, are allowed to breed.

Granted if riot wanted to stop sucking the dick of the all mighty dollar for 5 minutes they could whip up a nice little test that you have to pass before you can queue for ranked.

And thats just one of my many complaints.

You're acting like this problem goes away once you get out of bronze 5, people in silver don't ward either half the time (I'm guilty of this too) and when they do, they still miss the enemy team walking over it (Again, guilty of this). 

This game is based on skill, if you were as good as you seem to think you are, you'd be able to carry yourself out. And don't tell me it's not possible, people do it all the time.

Don't blame Riot for the fact you suck at the game. The only common factor in all of your games is you.

See id believe that i over value kills too if all i had to go on is my stats.

But i mained proxy singed for 6 months, and split push trynd for almost as long, two roles where arguably you literally feed till you win because all you do is push towers.

The reason i die alot on akali and diana despite getting ridiculous amounts of kills is once i reach the teamfight stage thats where my snowball ends, if my team isnt good enough to have gotten themselves a lead before then we simply cannot win teamfights period, because aside from doing what ill describe below there isnt a whole lot i can do, if i try to actually fight the teamfight unless my teams tank is fed enough to not blow up instantly and is smart enough engage first i literally cant do shit except for trade my life for their carries, because the second i engage into the fight proper, not just making a pick but a proper engage, im going to get focused with cc bursted down and then my team has to fight a 4v5.

So instead of trying to duke it out and ace them (which wont happen) i do the only thing i can do, i dive PAST their front line into the back line and take out as many squishies as i can before i get cc'd to death.

From there its up to my team to make use of the breathing room where they dont have that vayne silver bolting them to death of that cait critting them for 2k.

If they dont know what to do with that 40 seconds of breathing room, thats their problem not mine, ill just chalk the game off as unwinnable have a bit of a rant and go win the next one.

They are the ones that will consistently have that problem in all of their games if they dont know how to take advantage of advantageous scenarios.

One tier isn't one MMR point below your division. Just want you to understand that, there's quite a bit of a jump from tier to tier, that's why they exist in the fashion that they do. If you're supposed to be in silver 3, then you're far out of your rating in bronze 5. I don't care how you cut it, yes, golds in bronze are probably better, but you're still (if you're being honest) not supposed to be playing at that rank either apparently.

To your point about my ability to climb, I started this season in bronze 4, in no season since I started playing ranked in season 3 have I ever been anything other than bronze, and I have the icons to prove it. I'm in silver 5 now and peaked at silver 3 and somewhere in silver is probably my correct ranking. The system is designed to work itself out over time, you have 750+ games this season alone, it's got a pretty good idea of where you belong at the moment.

About teamwork, you're completely wrong, if your team has a weak member, you have to at least offer them some help, you can't just hope they'll do something useful while you race off to be a hero. Teamwork is figuring out the strengths and weaknesses of your team and maximising strengths while minimising weaknesses, not just pushing your strength while letting your weakness stay exposed. 

For example, I'll use your hypothetical (Sorry in advance for the tonne of numbers):

You, as a 14/8/3 Akali, dive in and pick off the 0/4/5 support, the 3/6/3 adc and the 2/3/1 jungler before being killed. This fight is probably going in your favour, huh? It's a 4v2 after all. 

Except your 4 are a 2/5/3 adc, a 1/4/1 top laner, a 3/7/2 jungler and a 0/6/1 support vs a 14/3/9 mid and an 11/2/10 top laner. When their two carries tear through the rest of your team and come out alive, you probably immediately go "How did my team fuck up a 4v2? GG Can't carry these nubs". You, as your team's primary carry, don't want to end up dead. Even if the tradeoff isn't 1 for 1, you sometimes need to understand that your 1 isn't equal to the 1, 2 or 3 you take out. This comes down to valuing your importance to the team vs the champion you're taking out on their team and I don't think you're doing this yet which is why you're struggling to carry as hard as you want to.

Don't believe me? Look at your stats across your entire account. You average almost 9 deaths a game, if you're the hyper carry for your team, you being dead is a really, really bad thing. Clown Fiesta games may feel like fun and provide some insane moments but you can't risk being dead for that long, especially with the changes to death timers which can really fuck you up. 

I'm not saying you don't ever deserve to climb, but I think you overvalue the importance of kill numbers rather than the significance of those kills to the state of the game.

Jesus you lack critical thinking ill spell it out for you.

A silver smurf =/= A gold smurf.

Two different levels of skill.

Two different gaps in skill between the rest of the players and you.

If i take a piece of glass and try to cut it with another piece of glass (bronze v bronze) it will take a long time to cut.

if i take a piece of metal and try to cut the piece of glass (silver against bronze) its a bit easier to cut but still takes a very long time.

If i take a diamond blade and try to cut the piece of glass (gold versus bronze) it will cut through like butter.

That is my one fucking problem with the league community.

They act like if you are even 1 mmr point below your true mmr that you should be able to 1v9 carry your games even though you are only 0.00000001% better than the other players in the game.

in reality to be able to solo carry yourself to your true elo you need to be better than your true elo.

I explained this in another comment, but just because you play like a silver 5 doesnt mean you will be silver 5.

You will likely be somewhere around bronze 3 or so for a very very long time until you grind your way to your true elo over a long period of time.

Those of you still going up entire leagues in under 100 games are nowhere close to your true elo so your experience doesnt apply.

For instance if you are gold and say "yeah well i escaped from bronze"

All im going to say is "how is your climb to plat going"

Same for every other rank, if you are still climbing you dont belong in your elo, but if its taking a very long time you also arent good enough to solo carry.

period.

Am i better than other bronze players? lets put it this way, i have only met i think 20 people that come to mind that can actually equal me in a 1v1 fight on equal ground and make me worried about losing lane, and an even smaller number of those people i cannot beat ever, its like 2.

Literally im not even overestimating in the last 2 weeks ive met one person who didnt need to have his entire team come to his lane to stop me from killing him under tower, and before you say "but its a team game" yes its a teamgame, and a team is only as strong as its weakest link, teamwork is not propping up the weakest character so that he doesnt have to be good to win, teamwork is boosting the strengths of your strongest characters so that they can hard carry you, do you peel the guy who keeps getting caught out, or do you peel your carry, js, in otherwords teamwork isnt being terrible alone and mildly decent together, teamwork is being good alone and amazing together.

Why the fuck do you think i main snowball champs lately, im a singed main and top lane main, my favorite play style is manipulating the game indirectly by proxying and shit since it makes me laugh, but i also understand that mechanically i am better than bronze and ive been taking advantage of that fact.

Does that mean im capable of 1v5ing? fuck no, but give me 4 kills a gunblade and vision of the enemy and ill get the team a triple kill 9 times out of 10, and ill do it solo.

But thats not enough to carry games, all that does is give me the power to roam around the map making it easier on my team, but as the saying goes you can lead a horse to water but you cant make them drink, aka i cant MAKE my team push their lanes after i kill their lane opponents AND the jungler so they cant be ganked, i cant MAKE my team come to dragon after i just flashed the wall and killed their smite etc etc.

That's still an issue with you. If your issue is that you go on tilt incredibly easily and that so negatively affects your play that it almost guarantees a loss streak, you need to work that out before you can say it isn't a problem with you.

And yeah, Rush (The former C9 jgler and also a NALCS MVP at one point) got killed by a bronze Lee Sin, shit happens in league in rare circumstances, especially if you're not expecting someone to play above their ranking in one given situation...

Also, you've created this whole thread about smurfs, but then say you have an account in silver 3 and believe that your skill level is silver 2 or higher. I get that this is your "main" account, don't bother arguing that as a point, I get it, but you would, by your own information be a smurf in bronze. So unless you're adding your own name to your dumbass list, feel free to stop posting this rubbish on the boards, especially as they're going to get player names redacted every time you post one.

This isnt a binary situation where b5 makes mistakes and b4 doesnt or something.

Less mistakes are made as you go up the elo.

As it stands i already know i can play at around silver 3, because i have another account there, it just sits there because thats not my main and i want to get THIS account out of bronze not that one, ive got too much stuff on this account to just piss it into the wind to not have b5 next to my name.

And no this game is not based on skill.

If this game was based on individual skill < key individual, id be ATLEAAST silver 2 if not low golds, since i am able to 1v1 diamond players on occasion, granted that depends on the player and the champ match up, but its the entire reason diamond players even have me added, fuck one of them added me because i legit shocked him when i first blooded him, and he was rengar.

What you dont get is that there is multiple variables that go into your ranking.

Your team is one of them but assuming every other variable stays consistent then eventually you will get above 50% winrate because only 4 bronzetards can be on your team and 5 can be on the enemy team, but this requires an ungodly number of games to achieve that statistical average.

But thats the thing people omit when they say that shit 
"every other variable HAS to stay the same every game"

Heres other variables that can determine if you win a game or not.

How are you feeling when you started the game, If you are in a good mood you are far more likely to snowball into a carrying nightmare fuel than you are to lose, and vice versa if you are in a shitty mood you are FAR more likely to make stupid mistakes.

I am living proof of this, if i leave league for a week (like i will be this week since the new poe patch dropped) in a week from now ill come back and go on a 5-6 game winstreak the day i come back, ATLEAST, and im predicting that now because i know it will happen, it happens every time i do that.

But then if you also look at my performance after a bad game, every game i lose compounds the effect, i will actually physically play worse, when i am angry, and sadly bronze players are bad enough that its not if i get angry at them, its WHEN i get angry at them.

And my final point to drive the final nail in the coffin, unless the premade that took me in because im a good midlaner got boosted, those 2 silver banners and that gold banner, in b5, probably theres a problem with mmr?
